Question.Text: A 7-year-old girl presents to a clinic in Peru with fever, myalgia, arthralgia, skin lesions/rash/itching, nausea/vomiting.

Answer: Bartonellosis (Carrion's disease/Oroya fever) - The patient presents with acute febrile illness with myalgia and skin lesions in Peru, an endemic region. The images show the characteristic verruga peruana (Peruvian warts) - reddish-purple nodular skin lesions caused by Bartonella bacilliformis transmitted by sandflies.
